Class JYCheckBox

java.lang.Object

                          de.javasoft.swing.JYCheckBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUIPropertySupport, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
JYCheckBoxList.CheckBoxRenderer, JYCheckBoxTree.CheckBoxRenderer
public class JYCheckBox
extends javax.swing.JCheckBox
implements IUIPropertySupport

JYCheckBox extends JCheckBox and supports a third HALF-SELECTED state. By default the HALF-SELECTED state can be modified by the user. However the method setStateInteractive(boolean) is intended to be used if you only want to set the third state programatically via setState(State). Optional UI-properties:

  • JYCheckBox.halfSelected.icon[.hover] - String, Icon path or className

    • Version:
    1.03, 15.06.2010
    See Also:
    JCheckBox, Serialized Form

    setStateInteractive

    public void setStateInteractive(boolean enabled)
    By default the checkbox state can be modified interactively. In case that the user shouldn't be able to set other states than SELECTED or DESELECTED, call this method with false as parameter.

    Parameters:
    enabled - True means, user is allowed to set checkbox state to State.HALF_SELECTED
    See Also:
    isStateInteractive(), JYCheckBox.State

    isStateInteractive

    public boolean isStateInteractive()
    Returns false if user is not allowed to select checkbox state State.HALF_SELECTED.

    Returns:
    True means, user is allowed to set checkbox state to State.HALF_SELECTED
    See Also:
    setStateInteractive, JYCheckBox.State
